Chapter.Heading: Some functions for accessing basic data

ManSection.Description:
Inputs a resolution, chain complex or cochain complex C and returns the function C!.boundary.
Examples: tutorial/chap2.html1 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTopology.html2

Inputs a chain or cochain complex C and integer n&tgt;0. It returns the n-th boundary map of C as a matrix.
Examples:

Inputs a resolution, chain complex or cochain complex C and returns the function C!.dimension .
Alternatively, inputs an FpG-module M and returns its dimension as a vector space over the field of p elements.
Examples: tutorial/chap3.html1 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoveringSpaces.html2 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoverinSpaces.html3 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutDefinitions.html4 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTDA.html5 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTopology.html6 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutLieCovers.html7

Inputs a component object X (such as a ZG-resolution or chain map) and a string str="name" (such as "characteristic" or "type"). It searches X.property for the pair ["name",value] and returns value. If X.property does not exist, or if ["name",value] does not exist, it returns fail.
Examples:

Inputs a ZG-resolution R and returns the group G.
Examples:

Inputs a resolution R and returns its length (i.e. the number of terms of R that HAP has computed).
Examples: tutorial/chap3.html1 , tutorial/chap4.html2 , tutorial/chap5.html3 , tutorial/chap10.html4 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutArithmetic.html5 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutBogomolov.html6 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutPerformance.html7 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoveringSpaces.html8 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoverinSpaces.html9 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutQuandles.html10 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutquasi.html11 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutRandomComplexes.html12 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutGouter.html13 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTensorSquare.html14 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTopology.html15

Inputs a chain map, or cochain map or equivariant chain map f and returns the mapping function (as opposed to the target or the source of f) .
Examples: tutorial/chap1.html1 , tutorial/chap2.html2 , tutorial/chap4.html3 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutAbelianCategories.html4 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoefficientSequence.html5 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCohomologyRings.html6 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutPoincareSeries.html7 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoveringSpaces.html8 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoverinSpaces.html9 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutFunctorial.html10 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutGouter.html11 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutTopology.html12

Inputs a chain map, or cochain map, or equivariant chain map, or FpG-module homomorphism f and returns it source.
Examples: tutorial/chap2.html1 , tutorial/chap10.html2 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutAbelianCategories.html3 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutNonabelian.html4 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoefficientSequence.html5 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoveringSpaces.html6 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoverinSpaces.html7 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutFunctorial.html8 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutLieCovers.html9

Inputs a chain map, or cochain map, or equivariant chain map, or FpG-module homomorphism f and returns its target.
Examples: tutorial/chap1.html1 , tutorial/chap2.html2 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutAbelianCategories.html3 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoefficientSequence.html4 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoveringSpaces.html5 , ../www/SideLinks/About/aboutCoverinSpaces.html6
